Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Astray \A*stray"\, adv. & a. [See {Estray}, {Stray}.] Out of the right, either in a literal or in a figurative sense; wandering; as, to lead one astray. [1913 Webster]
Ye were as sheep going astray. --1 Pet. ii. 25. [1913 Webster]

astray adv 1: away from the right path or direction; "he was led astray" 2: far from the intended target; "the arrow went wide of the mark"; "a bullet went astray and killed a bystander" [syn: {wide}]
